overview_of_class: Plant community ecology investigates the composition, structure, functioning, and dynamics of plant communities. Readings, discussions, lectures, and activities will address how plant communities are organized, how they interact with their biotic and abiotic environments, how they are studied, and how they are influenced by anthropogenic impacts.
name: Plant Community Ecology
title: TGS PBC 402-0-01 Plant Community Ecology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Plant community ecology investigates the composition, structure, functioning, and dynamics of plant communities. Readings, discussions, lectures, and activities will address how plant communities are organized, how they interact with their biotic and abiotic environments, how they are studied, and how they are influenced by anthropogenic impacts.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Lectures, literature and text readings, discussions, and activities.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Two exams (including the Final Exam), class participation, quizzes and writing assignments.

subject: PBC
